name: Krish Parikh
short_description: Krish Parikh is affiliated with the Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (SAIL) and Stanford University. He has volunteering experience as a Computer Science Teacher at SEWA International USA and has received several prestigious awards including the TreeHacks First Place Grand Prize and Lam Research Scholarship.
long_description:
Krish Parikh is currently affiliated with the Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (SAIL) and Stanford University. He has a background in computer science and has demonstrated exceptional academic and technical abilities.

His volunteering experience includes serving as a Computer Science Teacher at SEWA International USA from May 2020 to June 2023, where he likely taught programming and computer science concepts to students.

Krish has received several notable awards and recognitions:
- TreeHacks First Place Grand Prize (February 2024): Led the first all-freshmen team in TreeHacks history to win first place among 1,124 competitors. The team also won the Reazon Holdings award, which included round-trip tickets to Tokyo.
- Lam Research Scholarship (June 2023): Received a $10,000 scholarship for extraordinary achievement, awarded to only 11 students out of 5,250 graduating seniors.
- National Merit Scholarship Finalist (June 2023): Earned a $2,500 scholarship for academic excellence, placing in the 99th percentile of 1.5 million PSAT examinees.
- President's Volunteer Service Award (November 2021): Recognized by AmeriCorps for completing over 100 hours of volunteer service.

With 1K followers and 500+ connections on LinkedIn, Krish appears to be well-connected in his professional network. His achievements at such a young age (winning TreeHacks as a freshman) indicate he is at the beginning of what promises to be an impressive career in artificial intelligence or computer science.
